thread.title: APD arrested one of Texas’ most wanted, police say
thread.title_full: APD arrested one of Texas’ most wanted, police say | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Elise Kaplan / Journal Staff Writer
title: APD arrested one of Texas’ most wanted, police say
text:
Van Mai Quang, 33
Albuquerque police arrested one of Texas’ most wanted after chasing the barefoot man across several residential rooftops early Thursday morning, according to a department spokesman.
Shortly after 1 a.m. officers patrolling the 400 block of Glorieta NE spotted a vehicle driving erratically bearing a Texas license plate, said officer Fred Duran. The plate was connected to an open kidnapping case out of Texas, he said, and the driver, later identified as Van Mai Quang, 33, sped away and pulled into a driveway.
Quang was discovered to have a felony arrest warrant in Texas and is on Texas’ 10 most wanted list, Duran said.
“Officers pursued the individual, and at one point he gained access to a residential roof top by an unknown means,” hesaid. “The male continued to flee by jumping from roof top to roof top as officers continued to keep him in their sights.”
Officers set up a perimeter and were able to take Quang into custody. The victims of the alleged kidnapping, a woman and her children, were found safe in a local shelter, Duran said. The woman told police she and her children left Texas with Quang in order to get away from her family. A family member had reported them as missing or kidnapped.
Quang was booked into the Metropolitan Detention center. He will be extradited back to Texas on a felony warrant, Duran said.
